Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies. I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped, said Ken Auletta , author of "Googled: The End of the World As We Know It." "I think Eric Schmidt is burned out." he added. Windows first Speaking about the new partnership with Microsoft, Mr Stephen Elop said that "the game has changed from a battle of devices to a war of ecosystems". An ecosystem with Microsoft and Nokia has unrivalled scale around the globe, he said. Microsoft's chief executive Steve Ballmer was also present at the launch, underlining the importance of the deal to the computing giant.
